alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 6:53PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: .The Yukon River break up front is 5 miles upstream of Circle and is expected to reach Circle later this evening or overnight. The ice extends 90 miles upstream of Circle and there is flooding occuring 30 miles upstream of Circle. There is no clear path through the in place ice downstream of Circle for all this water and ice to move through. Flooding is expected to develop at Circle tonight as the run of ice and high water from upstream move downstream to Circle and form an ice jam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...Yukon near Circle. * WHEN...Until 630 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations near Circle is imminent. Buildings in low lying areas in Circle could flood. Large blocks of ice could push onshore damaging structures near the river bank. Water will rise rapidly tonight and Sunday after the ice jam forms. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM AKDT, The River Watch Team reports that ice remains in place on Yukon downstream of Circle. The Yukon River break up front is 5 miles upstream of Circle and is expected to reach Circle later this evening or overnight. A run of ice extends 90 miles upstream of Circle and there is flooding occuring 30 miles upstream of Circle. There is no clear path through the in place ice downstream of Circle for all this water and ice to move through. Flooding is expected to develop at Circle tonight as the run of ice and high water from upstream moves downstream to Circle and forms an ice jam. - Water could rise rapidly at Circle tonight and Sunday, flooding buildings in low lying areas. Ice could push onshore damaging structures near the river bank. People should take action now to move valuables away from the river, up off the floor, or to higher ground. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Circle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River near Circle stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
